jcr:content.jcr:title: Anabaptist Association of Australia and New Zealand

contentheadline.headline: Anabaptist Association of Australia and New Zealand

contentrichtext.text: The '''Anabaptist Association of Australia and New Zealand''' (AAANZ) is a network of individuals from a variety of Christian denominations in [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]] who share a common interest in the [[Anabaptist]] tradition.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thirdway.com/menno/glossary.asp?ID=60|title=Mennonites in Australia and New Zealand|publisher=Third Way CafÃ©|accessdate=2007-12-24| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20071124083502/http://www.thirdway.com/menno/glossary.asp?ID=60| archivedate= 24 November 2007 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://emm.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=48:subversive-anabaptism&catid=104:news-and-stories-asia-and-australia&Itemid=120|title=Subversive Anabaptism?|publisher=[[Eastern Mennonite Missions]]|accessdate=200810-11-22}}</ref> In 1998 the body was incorporated with about 80 members.<ref>Mennonite Brethren Herald (Vol. 38, No. 17)</ref> The association believes that the enduring legacy of the Anabaptists includes: * baptism upon profession of faith * church membership is voluntary and members are accountable to the Bible (read through the revelation of Jesus) and to each other * commitment to the way of peace and other teachings of Jesus as a rule for life * separation of church and state * worshipping congregations which create authentic community and reach out through vision and service ==Annual meetings== *1998 *1999, Wollongong, New South Wales, Australia *2000 *2001, Melbourne, Australia *2003, Sydney, Australia *2005, Canberra, Australia *2007, Perth, Australia *2009, Melbourne, Australia *2011, New Zealand ==Notes== <!--<nowiki> See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Footnotes for an explanation of how to generate footnotes using the <ref> and </ref> tags, and the template below. </nowiki>--> {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.anabaptist.asn.au/ Official website] [[Category:Christianity in Australia]] [[Category:Christianity in New Zealand]] [[Category:Religious organizations established in 1998]] [[Category:Anabaptist denominations and unions established in the 20th century]]
